reports.description: App should support bluetooth communications with both PushTracker and SmartDrive.

tests.name: Test 1
tests.preconditions: The app should be running and opened to the OTA page.
acceptanceCriteria: After the 'Searching for Devices' dialog, the SmartDrive should show up as an item in the list.
The app should show 'Awaiting versions' as the OTA status - within 1 minute the app should show the versions of the SmartDrive BLE and MCU.
The SmartDrive should reboot and OTA should begin.
The SmartDrive should reboot and OTA should stop.

tests.name: Test 2
tests.preconditions: The app should be running and opened to the OTA page. A PushTracker running version 1.5 should be present and turned on.
methods: On the PushTracker, begin pairing with the App.
Tell the PushTracker to connec to the app - then press the 'Refresh Device List' button on the app.
Press the 'Start' button (and then the 'Force' button if it shows).
acceptanceCriteria: The PushTracker should show pairing success - optionally after the user agrees to the pairing prompt on the phone.
The PushTracker should show up in the OTA device list.
The 'Start' button should display underneath the PushTracker.
The app should display 'Updating' underneath the PushTracker and the PushTracker should show the OTA status.

tests.name: PT OTA
tests.preconditions: The app should be running and opened to the OTA page. A pushtracker running version 1.5 should be on and already paired, but not connected to the app.
methods: Press the right button on the PushTracker to initiate app connection. Press 'Refresh Device List' in the app.
Press 'Begin Updates' in the app, then press the 'Start' button, then press the 'Force' button.
Wait until the OTA finishes - the PT must reboot. After the PT reboots, press the right button on the PT to turn it on and then press the right button to connect to the app.
acceptanceCriteria: The PushTracker should show up in the list of devices.
The app should show 'Updating' and the PT should show the OTA status.
The PushTracker should go into the 'pairing to app' setting menu - indicating that it has lost its pairing information and the OTA succeeded.

tests.name: SD OTA
tests.preconditions: The app should be running and opened to the OTA page. A SmartDrive running version 1.4 should be on and not connected to a PushTracker.
methods: Press 'Refresh Device List' in the app.
Press 'Begin Updates' and then 'Start' for the SmartDrive.
Wait until the OTA finishes and the ota status is displayed for the SmartDrive.
acceptanceCriteria: The SmartDRive should show up in the list of devices.
The app should show the firmware versions (1.4) for the SmartDrive and should then continue through the ota process.
The OTA status displayed should be 'Complete'

reports.description: App should gather activity data from the PushTracker during an evaluation.

tests.name: Test 1
tests.preconditions: The app should be running and opened to the trial page of the evaluation section. A PushTracker running version 1.5 should be turned on and already paired with the app. The PushTracker should already be paired with a SmartDrive and the SmartDrive should be on.
methods: Navigate to the 'Phase 1' page and press the 'Start' button.
Press the right button on the PushTracker to initiate an app connection, wait 10 seconds, then press the 'Start' button in the app.

Perform some push motions with the PushTracker. Connect the PushTracker to a SmartDrive and activate the SmartDrive for at least 3 seconds. Deactivate the SmartDrive. Press the 'Stop' button in the app.
acceptanceCriteria: The app should inform you to connect the PushTracker.
The trial should stop and should display the activity data collected from the PushTracker.
